topic.title: Alignment Issues of the Main Menu on Linux Systems Based on Gnome 3.x

section.title: Problem
section.p: On some Linux systems based on Gnome 3.x (Ubuntu 11.x, 12.x), the main menu of has alignment issues when you navigate it using your mouse.

section.title: Solutions
section.p: This is a known problem caused by Java SE 6 1.6.0_32 and earlier. You can resolve this problem using the latest Java SE 6 JRE from Oracle. To download the latest version, go to .

To bypass the JRE bundled with , go to the installation directory of and rename or move the jre folder. If does not seem to locate the system JRE, either set the JAVA_HOME environment variable to point to the location where you have installed the JRE, or you can simply copy that folder with the JRE to the installation directory and rename it to jre to take the place of the bundled JRE.
